channel.title: Sections on DIANA MOREIRA
channel.description: Recent content in Sections on DIANA MOREIRA

item.description: I’m an Assistant Professor at the University of California, Davis, Department of Economics. I’m also a Lemann Fellow, a Faculty Affiliate at the Center for Effective Global Action CEGA and an Invited Researcher for JPAL . My current research focus is in the field of Development Economics, in particular, its intersection with Public, Political and Organizational Economics. As a researcher, Iâ€™m interested in two topics, poor governance in governments and social mobility, both of which I study in the developing country context.
Email: dsmoreira@ucdavis.edu Tel: +1 (530) 754-1553 Address: Department of Economics 1140 SSH building, University of California, Davis Davis, CA 95616 U.S.A.

Media Coverage How Research Affects Policy: Experimental Evidence from 2,150 Brazilian Municipalities [NPR - Planet Money] [LiveMint] [El Comercio] [Folha de Sao Paulo] [Nexo Jornal] [Folha de Sao Paulo] Success Spills Over: How Awards Affect Winners and Peers Performance in Brazil [O Globo] Political Turnover, Bureaucratic Turnover and The Quality of Public Services [O Globo] Corrupting Learning: Evidence from Missing Federal Education Funds in Brazil [World Development Report Governance and Law] [Estado de Sao Paulo] [Veja]
Teaching ECN 290: Development As Effective Governments ECN 102: Analysis of Economic Data Office Hours If you are a current student, please check the syllabus for updated OH or by appointment.
